comments.body: Maybe another boss besides the kraken. The kraken just doesn't seem that minecrafty to me but a mob like it would be cool. Overall I really like this idea!

Yes this is exactly what I was thinking. :) maybe some type of material can make it where you can make pressurized suits and trying to fight in this area has big risks because if your suit breaks it could kill you faster than suffocation damage. Ima share this hopefully Stealth sees it.

Maybe a glow squid boss. :D or a blue dragon ( if they ever add a red dragon)

And with the abyss being so dark, normal light sources wouldnt work. Like sea pickes wouldnt work and maybe like how the warden is in the deep dark. Maybe a super strong but SCARY mob in the Abyss that might be guarding something unique. :D anyone got more ideas with this?
Also possibly in archeology, they could hint on this creature or the abysss. :D
a shark looking mob that is 5 blocks high and 10 blocks wide and that has a creepy texture

i was just about to write a post about this lol

this is exactly what i was thinking about. you need a special lightsource to venture in the abyss, and you can find special mobs down there, usually creepy or humongous

I like the general idea, but water pressure doesn't fit in Minecraft, as you already have to worry about breathing... which at that depth could be plenty to worry about. Also, night vision and normal light sources should work... there is no reason they wouldn't, however, maybe there could be a mob that gives you the blindness effect, or maybe light sources just emit less light (so magma blocks and such would not illuminate anything) this works well because many light sources don't work underwater anyways.

I was also thinking of a neutral mob, the jelly fish that could have similar mechanics to the glow squid except will defending itself by stunning the attacker and upon death it could drop raw jellyfish giving a little more saturation and 5 hunger points.
you could work on the name tho
That.. Would.. Be.. So.. Hard.. To.. Chop.. Down! But, yeah, good idea
I'd love to see the trees grow as tall as 100 or more blocks! Maybe taller!!

mushroom island is a very rare but unattractive biome, an update that would add a totally exclusive village would be really cool, it would be a much bigger village than the others, with its own villagers and more robust giant mushrooms, at night there could be fireflies that would be just glowing particles of different colors, as well as luminous mushrooms, making this peaceful island a truly magical discovery. thanks for reading :)
Plese ajout
Are there any hostile mobs in these structures?
Undead ender mobs could wander arround this structures. They would only attack you if you mine blocks. Endermites also could spawn in here
Interesting idea.

I like this idea. But, there is one problem. The Beam Cannon that you talk about would be extremely overpowered. It has to have its limits. Here are a few ideas for limitations you could have:

  • In order to shoot, it has to be fully powered. (Red stone block right next to it, no red stone dust or powered opaque blocks)
  • Powered up with special eyes of enter (maybe crafted with nether star?) that get worn down with durability
  • Entity being shot from cannon only travels certain distance
  • Reload speed between red stone signals
  • Must be activated by a player (right clicked)
  • Redstone pulse must be longer than one tick (observer proof)

You can use one or more for its limitations. The End‚Äôs world border is easier to reach than most other world borders. Setting up a simple rideable flying machine can get you there in a few hours. Infinite power can get boring. A real challenge keeps new players hooked and creative.

I hope you have a nice day!

-BD103

In order to balance the beam cannon I really think that charging it with some sort of ender item could be a good idea.  To charge it you could put eyes of ender inside it, and a visual representation in the side of the block like the one in the respawn anchor. Each eye of ender provides would provide 16 shoots, and a total of 4 eyes of ender could fit inside it.

Each shoot has a cooldown of three seconds and depending on the level of the redstone signal the shoot could be more or less powerfull 

To make it challenging to the player to the player to reach this end ruins a new mob could appear in this dimension to make travelling more dangerous. Maybye a neutral mob that attacks only if you are flying with elytra or when a piston is activated,  to prevent flying machines  

Thanks for all your feedback, if we all contribute to this idea we can make it true!!!!

Wow great idea! Moss would be so cool. You could place it on the sides or top of any block to make it look old and ruined.

Moss would also be great for my flooded forest idea. Heres the link if you wanna see how moss could tie in with it

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360058144392-Flooded-Forest
I think moss could also be used as a small pouch, like some people used in cavemen times
I love this, perhaps the wistmans wood could provide a white wood and a light grey bark? I believe white fences and fencegates would be a cool decorative colour!

I've seen a lot of posts about a Dark Dimension, Shadowfell, or Shadow Realm. I even tried making a post about it myself. I can see it being a black and white dimension that spawns more undead enemies and gets more challenging the longer you stay there. It would be interesting to see a dimension with no natural light too, meaning you would have to being torches to see anything other than the portal. 

I've heard that Mojang recently hired the people behind the Aether mod though, so that's a strong possibility to where a Crying Obsidian portal would lead too.
It'd be nice if you could encounter your deceased pets there, since this realm almost seems like a dream and heavenly.
This idea is perfect and exactly the kind of place id love to see!! üíï

And if you use bone meal on soul sand you get a dead bush soul sand you get a withered lily which is just a primark wither rose that doesn't damage the player but crafts one black die (upgrade wither roses to make 3 or 4 black dye. Dye* for every time I wrote die

An amazing idea I'd like to expand on. 

 

Firstly, the baby ghasts are disgusting and wiggly like larva. While shooting fireballs at the player, they will also scream and shout for help. Ghasts begin to follow the sounds of the crying infant, and are attracted to the players position. 

The soul trees could provide the player with some root, that will give them resistance for a short amount of time, but also an extreme slowness duration. 

New Ghast types: nothing crazy, but maybe something like the panada bears, where there are unique variants that add the small changes

This biome could have nests, which provide players the opportunity for little bits of lore or loot of some kind, just a thought
I hope more people see this.
the gasts already have a biome, the soul sand valley
Wither bones and blocks would also be a great addition to this biome! This would be a great addition to the game!
Good idea

I like the basic idea, but I have a couple opinions of my own here:

  • I think it would be better to have no lava at all in this biome. Seeing lava all the time is a bit of an eyesore, and this one seems like a good excuse to remove it. However, some kind of "wither water" could be cool.
  • I made my own Wither Alter suggestion a while ago. In my opinion, wither alters should be required for spawning the wither, as that creates an environment for fighting it and adds some novelty to the experience. As of now the wither fight is boring compared to the other boss fights.
And a pig creeper in New demension

well this for sure ain't entering the game (i made the post)
Great idea ! It would add new realistic landscapes into Minecraft!
I think each biome should have it's own beach, & here in the super foresty Pacific Northwest, we have stony gravely grey beaches, so gravel beaches for one type of forest biome would work.

I would love to have this as a cave biome that runs through warm biomes. This would be very fitting for the Caves and Cliffs update. Maybe they could be made of terracotta and red sandstone to give us a good source of red sandstone. To locate a canyon cave biome, look for monoliths made of red sandstone on the surface.

This will a great addition to caves and cliffs update. Adding more realistic terrain genration like the dried up canyons in the mesa along with dead fossils is really cool. Moreover mesa biome mineshafts should be more interesting type like the journey to the center of the earth typw theme but thats for another update i guess. I love this idea a lot since the animation after every announcement trailer feels very mysterious and scary (along with the thunder)

I too like the idea of adding mummies in the desert temple but there ahould be like maybe a booby trap on the ground and when you walk on it 5 mummies will appear with a sword or something and they should be able to spawn in light also but only on the surface

A special ore under the island would make people want to go there

Maybe the mycelium spores make caves under the island toxic
Yes, it could be changed...but there aren't enough ideas here.
Brilliant!  I never thought about the mushroom islands needing a revamp, but now that you mention it, I think you're right.  Contrary to another comment, I think there are plenty of ideas here.

I'd also like to suggest that the mushroom fields / islands get their own unique weather type as well. Instead of rain, it could be a matte/pastel purple spore snow of sorts. In addition, there should be particles floating around like the warped/etc. biomes in the nether, along with a sky color that matches the mycel.

 

The aforementioned spore snow would convert grass into mycelium if there's no roof over the grass. In addition, sheep could be changed into a new color similar to that of mycel and allow them to eat mycel rather than just grass.
